Course Description: CONCEPTUAL FRAMEWORK FOR FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING AND REPORTING PROVIDING IN DEPTH EXAMINATION OF THE ACCOUNTING PROCESS AND THE CONTENT OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, INCLUDING CASH, SHORT TERM INVESTMENTS, RECEIVABLES, INVENTORIES, CURRENT LIABILITIES, PLANT AND INTANGIBLE ASSETS AND LONG TERM INVESTMENTS. THIS COURSE MAY NOT BE TRANSFERABLE.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
COURSE CORE OBJECTIVES

REVIEW OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING, PLUS IN-DEPTH EXAMINATION OF BALANCE SHEET AND INCOME STATEMENT ITEMS HIGHLIGHTING RECENT FASB ANNOUNCEMENTS.

COURSE CORE OUTLINE

1.	OVERVIEW OF ACCOUNTING AND ITS THEORETICAL FOUNDATION.

	  A.	THE ACCOUNTING PROFESSION: HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT, - ASSOCIATIONS AND REGULATIONS.

	  B.	REVIEW OF THE ACCOUNTING PROCESS: PROCEDURES FOR COLLECTING, CLASSIFYING, RECORDING, SUMMARIZING AND INTERPRETING BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS.

C.	THE CONCEPTUAL FRAMEWORK: OBJECTIVES, CHARACTERISTICS, AND ELEMENTS OF ACCOUNTING INFORMATION.  FASB AND CURRENT ISSUES.

	  D.	FINANCIAL STATEMENT CONTENT: MEASURING AND REPORTING INCOME, REPORTING CHANGES IN RETAINED EARNINGS, PURPOSE AND CONTENT OF THE BALANCE SHEET.

2.	WORKING CAPITAL COMPONENTS:  CURRENT ASSETS AND CURRENT LIABILITIES.

A.	CASH AND TEMPORARY INVESTMENTS.

B.	RECEIVABLES: NATURE AND COMPOSITION - BALANCE SHEET PRESENTATION.

	  C.	INVENTORIES: COST, ESTIMATION AND VALUATION PROCEDURES.

	  D.	CURRENT LIABILITIES: MEASUREMENT, CLASSIFICATION, AND ESTIMATION.

3.	PLANT AND INTANGIBLE ASSETS, LONG-TERM INVESTMENTS.

	  A.	PLANT AND INTANGIBLE ASSETS: ACQUISITION, SUBSEQUENT COSTS, EVALUATING GOODWILL - DEPRECIATION AND AMORTIZATION - EXCHANGES AND DISPOSITIONS.

	  B.	LONG-TERM INVESTMENTS: IN DEBT AND EQUITY SECURITIES - IN OTHER ASSETS.

4.	LONG-TERM LIABILITIES.

	  A.	REVIEW OF ACCOUNTING FOR LONG-TERM LIABILITIES.

	  B.	BONDS: NATURE, KINDS, ACCOUNTING FOR ISSUANCE, CONVERSION, RETIREMENT, REFUNDING, VALUATION AND DEBT RESTRUCTURING.

	  C.	PRESENT VALUE: CONCEPTS AND APPLICATION TO LIABILITIES.

5.	OWNERS EQUITY.

	  A.	CONTRIBUTION CAPITAL: NATURE AND CLASSIFICATION OF CAPITAL STOCK - ISSUING STOCK - RIGHTS AND OPTIONS - TREASURY STOCK - RETIREMENTS AND CONVERSIONS - STOCK SPLITS - BALANCE SHEET PRESENTATION AND DISCLOSURES.

	  B.	RETAINED EARNINGS: ADDITIONS AND DEDUCTIONS - REPORTING BOOK VALUE PER SHARE - ANALYSIS AND CORRECTION OF ERRORS.

6.         FINANCIAL REPORTING.

	  A.	STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS: NATURE AND PURPOSE - DIRECT AND INDIRECT REPORTING ALTERNATIVES - PREPARATION OF STATEMENT.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

NONE.
